recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. In a pan, cook ground beef with chopped onions and garlic. Add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve sauce over spaghetti.

recipes.title: Vegan Tacos
recipes.instructions: Heat tortillas in a pan. Fill with black beans, sliced avocado, diced tomato, and chopped cilantro. Add salt and lime juice to taste.

recipes.title: Banana Pancakes
recipes.instructions: Blend banana, egg, oats, milk, and baking powder until smooth. Pour batter onto a hot skillet and cook until golden. Serve with maple syrup if desired.

recipes.title: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.instructions: Cut the chicken breast into small cubes and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch for about 10 minutes, heat oil in a pan and add dried red chilies, stir-fry for a few seconds until fragrant, add the marinated chicken and cook until golden brown, then set aside, in the same pan, stir-fry garlic, ginger, and bell pepper until slightly softened, return the chicken to the pan, add green onions, and toss in peanuts, in a bowl, mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, sugar, and a little sesame oil, pour the sauce into the pan and stir until everything is evenly coated, cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens, serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Jollof Rice
recipes.instructions: Blend fresh tomatoes, bell pepper, Scotch bonnet pepper, garlic, and ginger into a smooth paste, set aside, in a pot, heat vegetable oil and fry diced onions until translucent, add tomato paste and cook, stirring frequently, until it darkens, add the blended tomato mixture to the pot, season with thyme, curry powder, bay leaves, salt, and black pepper, and cook until the sauce reduces and thickens, add rinsed rice and stir well to coat it with the sauce, pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, once the rice is cooked, fluff with a fork and serve hot, optionally with grilled chicken or fried plantains.
